name: European Fire Safety Alliance
legal: none (project of the Dutch Burns Foundation)
bossPosition: Executive Director / Chair of the board
goal:
The European Fire Safety Alliance believes that most of the European fire victims in the home are preventable. The European Fire Safety Alliance is an independent alliance of fire professionals and exists to reduce the risk from fire.

- We Focus on areas of greatest fire risk and the people most vulnerable to accidental fires.
- We support the fire services, so they can be actively involved in reducing the risk from fire at a national and European level.
- We support, encourage and deliver research, studies and reports that highlight the dangers from fire in the home and support their widespread availability.
- We deliver strong consistent messages on home fire safety by respected fire professionals at national and EU level regarding measures to reduce the risk.
- We grow, nurture and sustain and strong professional fire network that supports improvements in fire safety.
interests: Budget, Communication, Consumers, Education and training, Energy, Environment, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Public Health, Research and innovation
euInitiatives:
The Fire Information Exchange Platform (FIEP)
Harmonised European fire statistics
